content.question: A block is moving on a surface that is inclined at an angle above the horizontal, as shown in the figure. The graph shown represents the gravitational potential energy <math alttext="U sub g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of the block-Earth system as a function of the position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> along the incline. The time period depicted in the graph is the time during which the block slides up the surface, comes to a stop, and then slides back down. Which of the following graphs shows the work <math alttext="W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>done by the gravitational force during the same time period?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in first quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters. The vertical axis is labeled W, in joules. The line begins at origin and moves upwards and to the right, reaches a peak, and then moves downward and to the right, ending along the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a graph in first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters. The vertical axis is labeled W, in joules. The line begins at near the top of the vertical axis above the origin and moves downward and to the right, touches the horizontal axis, and then moves upwards and to the right, ending at a height horizontally equal to where it began.

The figure presents a graph in fourth quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters. The vertical axis is labeled W, in joules. The line begins at origin and moves downwards and to the right, reaches a valley, and then moves upwards and to the right until ending along the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a graph in the first and fourth quadrants of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters. The vertical axis is labeled W, in joules. The line begins at origin and moves downwards and to the right. The line is then discontinued and begins at a new position approximately halfway across the horizontal axis, aligned with the origin. The line moves upwards and to the right until ending at the top of the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters. The vertical axis is labeled W, in joules. The line begins at the top of the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right until approximately halfway across the horizontal axis. The line is then discontinued at begins at a new position at the bottom of the vertical axis, and aligned vertically with the endpoint of the first line segment. The line moves horizontally to the right until ending near the rightmost point on the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph in fourth quadrant of the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x, in meters. The vertical axis is labeled W, in joules. The line begins at origin and moves downwards and to the right, reaches a valley, and then moves upwards and to the right until ending along the horizontal axis.
